item.title: Eisenstein Like Series
item.description: Remark Th 1 is one of the exercise problems in COMPLEX ANALYSIS by E.Stein(it is the last problem before the appendix). but the book only provide sketch of the solution, so I fill in details in this note. Th 1: $r_8(n) = 16\sigma_3^*(n)$ where $r_8(n) = \#\left\{(x1, x2, …, x8)\in|\sum x_i^2=n\right\}$ $16\sigma_3^*(n) = \begin{cases} \sigma_3(n)& \text{n is odd}\newline \sum_d|n& \text{n is even} \end{cases}$
